title: What is the connection between magic, the fear of losing one's soul, and humanity's perception of reality according to De Martino?
first_phrase: This text explores the views of De Martino on the magical experience. According to him, magic begins with the angst of a self that cannot face nature as a world of psychic forces. The soul is exposed to extreme risk, which makes all other lives meaningless. The text further delves into the risks of losing one's soul and the world while exploring the role of magic in arresting chaos and restoring order in nature. In the last 200 tokens, the author examines the interconnection of the magical risk of losing the world and the soul, the limits of nature, and the role of magic in re-subjugating it.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the concept of magic may seem like a way to protect oneself from the unknown, it is important to understand that true magic lies in the acceptance and understanding of the natural world around us. By acknowledging our place within it and respecting its laws, we can minimize the risks of spiritual disintegration and fully appreciate the wonders of our existence.
